arm_group.description: Subjects will be administered with S0597
The subjects will receive active comparator inhalation powder

brief_summary.textblock:
Sun Pharma Advanced Research company Limited has developed a dry powder inhaler  of compound
      S0597 for oral inhalation. This clinical study is a Phase I/IIa study to investigate the
      safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of single and multiple ascending
      doses of S0597 administered by oral inhalation to healthy volunteers and asthma patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacology Study of Sun Pharma Advanced Research Company Limited's S0597

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects  willing to provide informed consent

          -  Male or female subjects aged 18 to 65 years inclusive

          -  Body mass index (BMI) between 18.0 and 30.0 kg/m2 inclusive

          -  Non-smokers or ex-smokers

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects with a supine systolic blood pressure  ≥160 mmHg and/or a supine diastolic
             blood pressure ≥100 mmHg

          -  Subjects who have a significant infection or known inflammatory process on screening
             or admission.

          -  Subjects who are unlikely to co-operate with the requirements of the study.

          -  Positive serology for infectious disease (hepatitisB or C , HIV) at screening

intervention.other_name: The subjects will receive a matching placebo by oral inhalation.

facility.name: Quintiles Drug Research Unit at Guy's Hospital, Quintiles Ltd.,

clinical_study.official_title: Study to Access Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Compound S0597 by Oral Inhalation: A Phase I/IIa Observer and Double Blind, Placebo and Active Controlled Parallel and Crossover Study.

oversight_info.authority: United Kingdom: Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency

primary_outcome.description: The no of adverse events will be assessed to evaluate the safety and tolerability of compound SO597 in healthy male subjects and asthma patients
the no of subjects with adverse events will be assessed to evaluate the safety and tolerability of compound SO597 in healthy male subjects and asthma patients
primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with adverse events

primary_outcome.description: clinically significant changes from baseline in oral body temperature will be  assessed to evaluate the change in vital signs of compound SO597 in healthy male subjects and asthma patients
primary_outcome.measure: clinically significant changes in oral body temperature

primary_outcome.description: Clinically significant changes from baseline in pulse rate will be  assessed to evaluate the change in vital signs of compound SO597 in healthy male subjects and asthma patients
primary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant changes in pulse rate

primary_outcome.description: Clinically significant changes from baseline in respiratory rate will be  assessed to evaluate the change in vital signs of compound SO597 in healthy male subjects and asthma patients
primary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant changes in respiratory rate

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Cmax will be assessed to evaluate the pharmacokinetics of SO597 in healthy subjects and subjects with asthma.
AUC will be assessed to evaluate the pharmacokinetics of SO597 in healthy subjects and subjects with asthma.
Clinically significant change in serum cortisol levels will be assessed to evaluate the pharmacodynamics of S0597 in healthy and subjects with mild asthma
secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant change in serum cortisol levels

secondary_outcome.description: Clinically significant change in FEV1 will be assessed to evaluate the pharmacodynamics of S0597 in healthy and subjects with mild asthma
Clinically significant change in FeNo will be assessed to evaluate the pharmacodynamics of S0597 in healthy and subjects with mild asthma

clinical_study.source: Sun Pharma Advanced Research Company Limited

lead_sponsor.agency: Sun Pharma Advanced Research Company Limited

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics/Dynamics Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
